{{flagicon|Australia}} [[Stan Jones (racing driver)|Stan Jones]] |align="left"| [[Holden 48-215|Holden FX]] | 64th |- |} ==Gliding== After a conversation with [[Birabongse Bhanudej|Prince Bira]], who was an avid glider competitor, Gaze tried his hand at the sport. He became an active member of the Bristol and Gloucestershire [[Gliding]] Club, at [[Nympsfield]] and went on to represent Australia in the 1960 [[World Gliding Championships]], which was held at the [[RAF Butzweilerhof|Butzweiler airfield]], near [[Cologne|Köln]]. ==Personal life== Tony Gaze was married twice; to Kay Wakefield who died in 1976 and to fellow racing car driver [[Diana Davison]] who died in 2012. Davison was the widow of [[Lex Davison]].{{cite web|url=http://www.grandprix.com/gpe/drv-gazton.html|title=Drivers: Tony Gaze|work=www.grandprix.com|accessdate=28 March 2016}} Gaze was also step-grandfather to the third generation of Davison racing drivers, [[Alex Davison|Alex]], [[Will Davison|Will]] and [[James Davison|James]]. ==See also== * [[List of World War II flying aces]] ==References== {{reflist|30em}} ==Further reading== *{{cite book|title=Almost Unknown: Squadron Leader Tony Gaze OAM DFC: Fighter Pilot and Racing Driver|author=Stewart Wilson|location=Lane Cove NSW|publisher=Chevron Publishing Group|year=2009|isbn=978-0-9805912-1-7}} ==External links== *{{cite web|url=http://brew.clients.ch/Gaze41Sqdn.htm|title=Squadron Leader F. A. O. "Tony" Gaze, DFC: An Australian Ace|author=Allan Hillman |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120222154406/http://brew.clients.ch/Gaze41Sqdn.htm |archivedate=22 February 2012 |accessdate=28 March 2016}} * [http://www.tonygaze.com/ Website about Tony Gaze] {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Gaze, Tony}} [[Category:1920 births]] [[Category:2013 deaths]] [[Category:24 Hours of Le Mans drivers]] [[Category:Australian Formula One drivers]] [[Category:Australian racing drivers]] [[Category:Hersham and Walton Motors Formula One drivers]] [[Category:12 Hours of Hyères drivers]] [[Category:12 Hours of Reims drivers]] [[Category:12 Hours of Pescara drivers]] [[Category:World Sportscar Championship drivers]] [[Category:Australian World War II flying aces]] [[Category:Racing drivers from Melbourne]] [[Category:Recipients of the Distinguished Flying Cross and two Bars (United Kingdom)]] [[Category:Recipients of the Medal of the Order of Australia]] [[Category:Royal Air Force officers]] [[Category:Royal Air Force personnel of World War II]] [[Category:Shot-down aviators]] [[Category:People educated at Geelong Grammar School]]

revision.comment: Fix cite date errors
revision.text:
'''''Trump vs. Bernie''''' is a satirical comedy act created by [[Anthony Atamanuik]] and [[James Adomian]] that imagines a series of fictional presidential debates between [[Donald Trump]] and [[Bernie Sanders]] during the [[2016 Presidential Election]]. In a deliberately absurd anachronism, "Trump" (Atamnuik) and "Bernie" (Adomian) engage in inter-party debates long before their parties' nominations are decided. Originating in October 2015 as a live sketch at the [[Upright Citizens Brigade Theatre]] (UCB) in New York, ''Trump vs. Bernie'' continued throughout the 2016 election season as a 40-city live comedy debate tour and spawned a special one-hour appearance on [[Comedy Central]]'s [[@midnight]], two hour-long specials produced for [[Fusion TV|Fusion]], and a comedy album released by [[Comedy Dynamics]], along with numerous appearances on news and comedy programs, radio shows, and podcasts.<ref name=":0">{{Cite news|url=https://artsbeat.blogs.nytimes.com/2015/10/21/trump-vs-bernie-round-2-debate-heads-for-new-york-comedy-festival/|title='Trump vs. Bernie,' Round 2: Debate Heads for New York Comedy Festival|last=Zinoman|first=Jason|work=ArtsBeat|access-date=2018-02-24|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.esquire.com/entertainment/tv/a54801/the-president-show-anthony-atamanuik-donald-trump-review/|title=Trump Impersonator Anthony Atamanuik Hopes to Make Satire Part of the Fourth Estate|date=2017-04-28|work=Esquire|access-date=2018-02-24|language=en-US}}</ref><ref name=":1">{{Cite news|url=http://deadline.com/2016/12/midnight-host-chris-hardwick-comedy-central-talking-dead-trump-bernie-debate-1201865452/|title=‘@midnight’ Host Chris Hardwick On New Slot, Show’s Political Transformation, Post-Election Plans & ‘Talking Dead’|last=Andreeva|first=Nellie|date=2016-12-08|work=Deadline|access-date=2018-02-24|language=en-US}}</ref><ref name=":2">{{Cite news|url=http://deadline.com/2016/03/trump-vs-bernie-series-donald-trump-bernie-sanders-fusion-1201712660/|title=‘Trump Vs. Bernie’ Series Is Yuuuuge Deal For Fusion|last=Pedersen|first=Erik|date=2016-03-02|work=Deadline|access-date=2018-02-24|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.pastemagazine.com/articles/2016/07/bernie-sanders-and-donald-trump-debate-in-forthcom.html|title=Bernie Sanders and Donald Trump Debate in Forthcoming Comedy Album|work=pastemagazine.com|access-date=2018-02-24|language=en}}</ref>
== Background ==
Adomian began impersonating Sanders in May 2015, making an appearance on [[Dan Harmon]]'s podcast ''[[Harmontown]]'' and in a [[Funny or Die]] short with a television debut on a September episode of @midnight.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.harmontown.com/2015/05/episode-147-high-concept-humiliation/|title=Episode: 147 – High Concept Humiliation {{!}} Harmontown|website=www.harmontown.com|language=en-US|access-date=2018-02-24}}</ref><ref>{{Citation|title=Bernie Sanders Is Not Boring|url=http://www.funnyordie.com/videos/c563893ec1/bernie-sanders-raw|language=en|accessdate=2018-02-24}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://splitsider.com/2015/09/learn-about-bernie-sanderss-social-media-habits-with-james-adomian/|title=Learn About Bernie Sanders’s Social Media Habits with James Adomian|date=2015-09-17|work=Splitsider|access-date=2018-02-24|language=en-US}}</ref> Atamanuik performed as Trump at various improv shows starting in August 2015, resulting in a one-man show at UCB New York entitled "Trump Dump."<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/04/23/arts/television/trump-becomes-a-late-night-host-on-comedy-centrals-the-president-show.html|title=Trump Becomes a Late-Night Host on Comedy Central’s ‘The President Show’|last=Itzkoff|first=Dave|date=2017-04-23|work=The New York Times|access-date=2018-02-24|language=en-US|issn=0362-4331}}</ref> The duo, having known each other from the improv scene since 2008, connected to stage a fake debate in a one-off live sketch on October 12, 2015 at UCB's stand-up showcase ''"''Whiplash."<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/tv/la-ca-st-trump-sanders-show-20160501-story.html|title=Anthony Atamanuik and James Adomian have turned 'Trump vs Bernie' into a comedy hit|last=Rottenberg|first=Josh|website=latimes.com|access-date=2018-02-25}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.cleveland.com/entertainment/index.ssf/2017/11/james_adomian_the_hilarious_be.html|title=James Adomian, the hilarious 'Bernie' in 'Trump vs. Bernie' parody, performs at the Winchester in Lakewood Nov. 15|work=cleveland.com|access-date=2018-02-24|language=en-US}}</ref> An edited video of the performance uploaded to YouTube was well-received by websites like [[Salon (website)|Salon]] and [[The Daily Dot|Daily Dot]], which lead to a subsequent show at the New York Comedy Festival, where the "debate" was moderated by [[The Daily Show]] correspondent [[Hasan Minhaj]].<ref name=":0" /><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.instagram.com/p/-uN0A0vZTo/|title=Hasan Minhaj on Instagram: "Moderating #trumpvsbernie. Photo: @withreservation"|website=Instagram|language=en|access-date=2018-02-25}}</ref>
== ''Trump vs. Bernie'' Debate Tour 2016 == [[File:Tvb tour boston.png|thumb|Trump vs. Bernie marquee in Boston [[File:TVB james tony montreal jfl.png|frameless]]Adomian and Atamanuik at the 2016 JFL Festival in Montreal. ]] In January 2016, dates for an initial 12-city US debate tour were announced.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://splitsider.com/2016/01/james-adomian-and-anthony-atamanuik-are-going-on-a-trump-vs-bernie-debate-tour/|title=James Adomian and Anthony Atamanuik Are Going on a ‘Trump vs. Bernie’ Debate Tour|date=2016-01-06|work=Splitsider|access-date=2018-02-25|language=en-US}}</ref> Debates were held in [[Portsmouth, New Hampshire|Portsmouth]] and [[Manchester, New Hampshire|Manchester]] a day before the [[2016 New Hampshire primaries|New Hampshire presidential primaries]] that both the real Trump and Sanders won. The tour grew to a total of 40 cities and had an international leg in Amsterdam, Dublin, London, and Montreal.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://twitter.com/trumpvsbernie/status/745720719355478017|title=#TrumpvsBernie takes the debate abroad in July! Amsterdam, Dublin, London, Montreal! http://trumpvsbernie.com pic.twitter.com/P4MyDBdXSM|last=BERNIE|first=TRUMP VS|date=<!--1:50 PM - -->22 June 2016|website=@trumpvsbernie|language=en|accessdate=2018-02-25}}</ref> Each debate was moderated by a celebrity guest such as [[Baratunde Thurston]], [[Andy Richter]] and [[Mark Hamill]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://twitter.com/trumpvsbernie/status/743485963863756800|title=The esteemed @AndyRichter moderates #trumpvsbernie Mon 6/20 8:30pm @LargoLosAngeles Tickets: http://ow.ly/eOxX301kFvT pic.twitter.com/sUOOHOLxjx|last=BERNIE|first=TRUMP VS|date=<!--9:50 AM - -->16 June 2016|website=@trumpvsbernie|accessdate=2018-02-25}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://twitter.com/trumpvsbernie/status/751581360335314944|title=The debate only a Master Jedi could handle! Thank you @HamillHimself for taking the time to moderate our little showpic.twitter.com/IUH77mbUEs|last=BERNIE|first=TRUMP VS|date=<!--5:58 PM - -->8 July 2016|website=@trumpvsbernie|language=en|accessdate=2018-02-25}}</ref> The tour concluded at the [[Just for Laughs|Just for Laughs Festival]] in Montreal where Atamanuik and Adomian were honored as two of ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'' magazine's 10 Comics to Watch for 2016.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://variety.com/2016/tv/news/10-comics-to-watch-2016-1201789465/|title=Variety Announces 10 Comics to Watch for 2016|last=Staff|first=Variety|date=2016-06-06|work=Variety|access-date=2018-02-25|language=en-US}}</ref>[[File:Anthony Atamanuik, Jon Favreau & James Adomian as Trump & Sanders (27874311542).jpg|thumb|372.997x372.997px|[[Jon Favreau (speechwriter)|Jon Favreau]] moderates a mock "Trump vs. Bernie" debate with [[Anthony Atamanuik]] as [[Donald Trump]] and [[James Adomian]] as [[Bernie Sanders]]. ]]
== @midnight guest appearance == On March 23, 2016, @midnight deviated from its usual three-person panel game format to host an hour-long ''Trump vs. Bernie'' debate moderated by host [[Chris Hardwick]]. According to Hardwick, a Comedy Central executive present at the taping decided to preempt originally scheduled programming to extend the 30 minute show to an hour because he was so impressed.<ref name=":1" /> Billed as "socialist vs. sociopath," the episode was subsequently posted to YouTube and has amassed over 7 million views.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://deadline.com/2016/03/trump-bernie-debate-midnight-chris-hardwick-1201725626/|title=‘Trump & Bernie’ Debate On ‘@midnight’: Chris Hardwick Moderates "Socialist Vs. Sociopath"|last=Pedersen|first=Erik|date=2016-03-24|work=Deadline|access-date=2018-02-25|language=en-US}}</ref>
== Fusion television specials == On [[Super Tuesday 2016|Super Tuesday]], the [[Fusion TV|Fusion]] network ordered an hour-long debate special and hour-long sketch show special based on the act along with digital content that began with a livestream on Fusion's F-Comedy Facebook page later that night.<ref name=":2" />
=== ''Trump vs. Bernie: Debate for America'' (2016) === The debate special aired April 27h, 2016.<ref>{{Citation|last=FUSION|title=Trump vs. Bernie • Debate for America (Full Special)|date=2016-04-27|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YfXdmHseiFA|accessdate=2018-02-25}}</ref> It is moderated by [[Paul F. Tompkins]], Brianna Baker, and [[Rhea Butcher]].<ref>{{Citation|last=Feinartz|first=Steven|title=Trump vs. Bernie: Debate for America|date=2016-04-27|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt5664904/|others=James Adomian, Anthony Atamanuik, Brianna Baker|accessdate=2018-02-25}}</ref> [[Betsy Sodaro]] plays a protester who heckles Trump throughout the debate. When Sodaro storms the stage, Trump brandishes a gun and shoots her. The special ends with Bernie rushing to Sodaro and tackling Trump.
=== ''Trump vs. Bernie: Shout the Vote!'' (2016) === ''Trump vs. Bernie: Shout the Vote!'' aired later the next month on May 11, 2016. Presented as "Loudbox," a cable news program hosted by [[Rachel Maddow]] (Atamanuik) and [[Chris Matthews]] (Adomian) with panelists [[Donna Brazile]] ([[Nicole Byer]]), [[Jeb Bush]] ([[Daniel Van Kirk]]), and [[Ben Carson]] ([[Jerry Minor]]), the pundits ignore an impending cataclysmic asteroid strike in favor of political optics while throwing to interviews and field pieces with Trump and Bernie. Atamanuik also impersonates alleged serial killer [[Robert Durst]] while Adomian plays former Governor of Minnesota [[Jesse Ventura]].<ref>{{Citation|title=Trump vs. Bernie: Shout the Vote (TV Movie 2016)|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt5814014/fullcredits|accessdate=2018-02-25}}</ref>
== ''Live from Brooklyn'' (comedy album) == Comedy Dynamics released ''Trump vs. Bernie: Live from Brooklyn Starring Anthony Atamanuik and James Adomian'' on July 29, 2016 on vinyl as well as on iTunes and other streaming services.[https://www.pastemagazine.com/articles/2016/07/bernie-sanders-and-donald-trump-debate-in-forthcom.html] The album featured a tour debate moderated by the [[HuffPost|Huffington Post]]'s [[Howard Fineman]]. It debuted at #5 on Billboard's Comedy Album charts.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/anthony-atamanuik/chart-history/comedy-albums/song/988312|title=Anthony Atamanuik Trump vs Bernie: Live From Brooklyn Chart History|work=Billboard|access-date=2018-02-25}}</ref> {| class="wikitable" !Track !'''Title''' !Duration |- |1 |Debate Moderator: Howard Fineman |5:32 |- |2 |Opening Statement: Donald Trump |3:22 |- |3 |Opening Statement: Bernie Sanders |2:53 |- |4 |Election Strategy |5:55 |- |5 |Race in America |4:40 |- |6 |Climate Change ([https://soundcloud.com/comedydynamics/climate-change/s-7YT4o Sample]) |5:00 |- |7 |Economic Issues |6:31 |- |8 |Planned Parenthood |3:56 |- |9 |Social Issues |5:27 |- |10 |Personal Beliefs |4:01 |- |11 |Immigration Reform |4:38 |- |12 |Media and Democracy |4:02 |- |13 |Random Statements |1:07 |- |14 |Gun Control |4:05 |- |15 |Foreign Policy |4:37 |- |16 |First 100 Days: Donald Trump |4:12 |- |17 |First 100 Days: Bernie Sanders |5:51 |- |18 |Good Night and Fuck You |0:55 |}
== Other media appearances ==
Atamanuik and Adomian promoted the debate tour in character on an episode of ''[[Comedy Bang! Bang!]]'' that also features [[Gilbert Gottfried]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.earwolf.com/episode/trump-vs-bernie/|title=Trump vs. Bernie, episode #399 of Comedy Bang Bang: The Podcast on Earwolf|website=www.earwolf.com|language=en-US|access-date=2018-02-26}}</ref> On February 12, 2016, a week after the New Hampshire primary, CNN's [[Brooke Baldwin]] interviewed Atamanuik and Adomian on [[CNN Newsroom (CNNI)|Newsroom]] as if they were the real life candidates.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://splitsider.com/2016/02/watch-james-adomian-and-anthony-atamanuiks-trump-vs-bernie-cnn-interview/|title=Watch James Adomian and Anthony Atamanuik’s ‘Trump vs. Bernie’ CNN Interview|date=2016-02-12|work=Splitsider|access-date=2018-02-25|language=en-US}}</ref> The duo has appeared on [[The Howard Stern Show]] twice: first in June 2016 and again after the [[United States presidential election, 2016#Results|election of Donald Trump]].<ref name="howardstern.com">{{Cite web|url=https://www.howardstern.com/show/2016/11/9/donald-trump-and-bernie-sanders-discuss-outcome-historic-election/|title='Donald Trump' and 'Bernie Sanders' Discuss Outcome of Historic Election|website=Howard Stern|language=en|access-date=2018-02-25}}</ref><ref name="howardstern.com"/>
== Reception == Both Atamanuik and Adomian have received praise for their portrayals. Critic for ''[[The New York Times]]'' [[Jason Zinoman]] said of their initial debate, "The best sketch about the current political campaign that I've seen this year was not on '[[Saturday Night Live]].'"<ref name=":0" /> Dan Caffrey of [[The A.V. Club]] credits Atamanuik with taking a "psychological approach" with "moments of self-awareness" that allows him explore the emptiness of Trump's soul.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://tv.avclub.com/the-president-show-gifts-donald-trump-with-frightening-1798191151|title=The President Show gifts Donald Trump with frightening moments of self-awareness|last=Caffrey|first=Dan|work=TV Club|access-date=2018-02-25|language=en-US}}</ref> Both Salon and Huffington Post called Adomian's Sanders better than [[Larry David]]'s, which Jené Gutierrez of the Daily Dot attributed to his ability to not only capture the essence of Sanders, but to bolster it with improvisation that "communicates complex issues in an accessible way" and transforms it into "smart and subtly flattering comedy."<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.salon.com/2015/10/20/no_offense_larry_david_but_this_is_the_best_bernie_sanders_impression_in_the_game/|title=No offense, Larry David, but ''this'' is the best Bernie Sanders impression in the game|date=2015-10-20|work=Salon|access-date=2018-02-25|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/bernie-sanders-impersonation_us_562435e7e4b0bce34701253b|title=Larry David Was Pretty, Pretty Good As Bernie Sanders, But This Comedian Is Even Better|last=Fang|first=Marina|date=2015-10-19|work=Huffington Post|access-date=2018-02-25|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.dailydot.com/upstream/james-adomian-bernie-sanders-impression/|title=James Adomian and the art of the Bernie Sanders impression {{!}} The Daily Dot|date=2015-12-19|work=The Daily Dot|access-date=2018-02-25|language=en-US}}</ref> Comedian [[Patton Oswalt]] agreed saying, "[ James Adomian ] and [ Anthony Atamanuik ] are the scary best at everything.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://twitter.com/pattonoswalt/status/656524519566278656|title=Yep! 'Cuz @JAdomian and @TonyAtamanuik are the scary best at everything. Watch and gape:https://twitter.com/salon/status/656500829193674752 …|last=Oswalt|first=Patton|date=<!--10:36 AM - -->20 October 2015|website=@pattonoswalt|accessdate=2018-03-20}}</ref> Actor Mark Hamill said of the routine, "Beyond hilarious! On a scale of 1-10, it's an 11! TREMENDOUS Trump. BRILLIANT Bernie."
== Aftermath == After the election of Donald Trump, Comedy Central premiered ''The President Show'' on April 27, 2017 as a weekly late-night show starring Atamanuik.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/04/03/arts/television/trump-talk-show-comedy-central-anthony-atamanuik-the-president-show.html|title=A Trump Talk Show, Courtesy of Comedy Central|last=Itzkoff|first=Dave|date=2017-04-03|work=The New York Times|access-date=2018-02-25|language=en-US|issn=0362-4331}}</ref> Adomian reprised his role as Bernie on an episode of the show as well as on its one-hour special "I Came Up With Christmas."<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://splitsider.com/2017/05/donald-trump-catches-up-with-his-old-friend-bernie-sanders-on-the-president-show/|title=Donald Trump Catches Up with His Old Friend Bernie Sanders on ‘The President Show’|date=2017-05-19|work=Splitsider|access-date=2018-02-25|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://splitsider.com/2017/12/watch-some-clips-from-the-president-shows-one-hour-special-i-came-up-with-christmas/|title=Watch Some Clips from ‘The President Show’s One-Hour Special ‘I Came Up with Christmas’|date=2017-12-01|work=Splitsider|access-date=2018-02-25|language=en-US}}</ref>
== External links == * [http://trumpvsbernie.com/ Official website] * [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8Poi5x0E2CM @midnight Presidential Debate] (Comedy Central) * [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YfXdmHseiFA Trump vs. Bernie: Debate for America] (Fusion) * [[imdbtitle:5664904|Trump vs. Bernie: Debate for America]] (IMDb) * [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hwA5cYcJNpc Trump vs. Bernie: Shout the Vote!] (Fusion) * [https://www.imdb.com/title/tt5814014/?ref_=nv_sr_3 Trump vs. Bernie: Shout the Vote] (IMDb) * [https://www.howardstern.com/show/2016/6/27/donald-trump-and-bernie-sanders-debate-issues-isis-executive-orders-and-robin-quivers-breasts/ Trump and Bernie Debate the Issues] (''The Howard Stern Show'') <!-- Important, do not remove this line before article has been created. -->
== References == <!-- Inline citations added to your article will automatically display here. See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/WP:REFB for instructions on how to add citations. --> {{reflist}}

{{Multiple issues| {{original research|date=November 2010}} {{advert|date=November 2010}} }}
'''The Virginia Pumpkin Festival''' is an annual event held since 2007 in the town of [[Virginia, County Cavan]] in the [[Republic of Ireland]]. The festival takes place every [[bank holiday]] weekend at [[Halloween]] at the end of October.
==History== {{Unreferenced section|date=November 2010}} The festival began in 2007 with crowds of up to ten thousand. On the Friday night the whole town was suddenly pitch black, before being completely lit up by candle light from pumpkin lanterns which were placed throughout the town. The events continued on Saturday with a variety of activities for all ages which included pumpkin olympics, arts and crafts exhibitions and music from local band "[[RHETOFIRE]]". Then followed the Pumpkin King and Queen competition when perfectly dressed Ladies and Gentlemen representing the public houses in the town were interviewed, Avril Soden and Martin Tynan were crowned as king and queen. On the Sunday afternoon the main event of the festival took place, pumpkin weigh in followed by a parade. The winner of the first ever Virginia Pumpkin Competition was Ed Molloy from Co. Longford.This year, the Festival was launched by famous chef Richard Corrigan.<ref>[http://virginia.ie/index.php?page=about-the-festival] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100819102103/http://virginia.ie/index.php?page=about-the-festival |date=August 19, 2010 }}</ref>
==Festival== The Whirlygig Fire parade and was followed by a firework display.<ref>{{cite web|author=D McWilliams |url=http://www.independent.ie/national-news/pumpkin-up-the-volume-halloween-festival-fun-1510790.html |title=Pumpkin up the volume Halloween festival fun - National News, Frontpage |publisher=Independent.ie |date=2008-10-27 |accessdate=2010-10-06}}</ref> Throughout the years the event has grown and grown just like the size of the pumpkins which enter the main competition of the weekend, Virginia town has welcomed growers from Ireland, Britain and Italy to attempt to win a cash prize the pumpkins are judged on their, size and shape and colour. They also included a live weigh-in of Ireland's heaviest pumpkins. The events which took place last year (2007) happened again but to make it distinctive, the organisers produced other attraction for the weekend in 2008. Some of these were a fancy dress Halloween party, kids treasure hunt, and even cookery demonstrations. They also added such events as the teddy bear picnic and with live performances from a wide range of acts, such as the music like [[Shane MacGowan]], [[Sharon Shannon]] and [[Mundy]] entertained crowds in the Pumpkin Marquee. There was also a street performance from the Whirligig theatre group who travelled from [[Co Donegal]].<ref>[http://www.independent.ie/national-news/town-lights-up-for-pumpkin-fete-1510087.html By Senan Hogan Saturday October 25, 2008]</ref> In 2009 [[Bell X1]] <ref>By Denise Clarke Monday October 26, 2009 http://www.independent.ie/national-news/thrills-and-spills-at-pumpkin-festival-1924393.html</ref> performed over the weekend and there was also music from Country music singers Declan Nerney and Philomena Begley at the Farmers' Dance in the Pumpkin Marquee as well.<ref>{{cite web|author=independent.ie phone apps |url=http://www.independent.ie/travel/inside-ireland/10-scariest-halloween-thrillers-1923646.html |title=10 scariest Halloween thrillers - Inside Ireland, Travel |publisher=Independent.ie |date=2009-10-24 |accessdate=2010-10-06}}</ref>
== References == <!--- See [[Wikipedia:Footnotes]] on how to create references using <ref></ref> tags which will then appear here automatically --> {{Reflist}} *http://www.independent.ie/national-news/town-lights-up-for-pumpkin-fete-1510087.html By Senan Hogan Saturday October 25, 2008 *http://www.independent.ie/travel/inside-ireland/10-scariest-halloween-thrillers-1923646.html *By Denise Clarke Monday October 26, 2009 http://www.independent.ie/national-news/thrills-and-spills-at-pumpkin-festival-1924393.html *http://www.independent.ie/national-news/pumpkin-up-the-volume-halloween-festival-fun-1510790.html
== External links == Cole P., Hurley J., Great Pumpkins: Tricks and Treats for Halloween, 2003, Chronicle Books. * {{Official site|http://www.pumpkinfestival.ie/}} * [https://web.archive.org/web/20100819102103/http://virginia.ie/index.php?page=about-the-festival]

[[File:Flying flags at the World Water Week in Stockholm.jpg|thumb|World Water Week in Stockholm]]
'''World Water Week in Stockholm''' is a week-long global water [[Academic conference|conference]] held each year in late August or early September.<ref>[http://www.worldwaterweek.org World Water Week website]</ref> Known as World Water Week, the event is organized and led by the [[Stockholm International Water Institute]] (SIWI). Events and conference sessions address a wide range of the world's [[water supply|water]], development and [[sustainability]] issues and related concerns of international development.
Over 3300 participants attended the conference in 2017.<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url=http://www.worldwaterweek.org/|title=World Water Week|last=|first=|date=4 June 2018|website=http://www.worldwaterweek.org/|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=5 June 2018}}</ref> The week feature experts and representatives from business, governments, water management and science sectors, intergovernmental and non governmental organisations, research and training organisations, and United Nations agencies. The conference features plenary sessions and panel debates, scientific workshops, poster exhibitions, side events and seminars. In 2017, 380 organisations from 138 countries all over the world participated in World Water Week<ref name=":0" />.
Functioning as an open and dynamic platform, World Water Week aims to link practice, science, policy and decision-making. It enables participants to exchange views and experiences, form partnerships and shape joint solutions to global water challenges. During the week, the [[Stockholm Water Prize]], the [[Stockholm Junior Water Prize]], and the [[Stockholm Industry Water Award]] are given out at their respective award ceremonies.
== History ==
The World Water Week in Stockholm originally began as the Stockholm Water Symposium in 1991 and has been convened annually ever since. In 2001, the official name became World Water Week in Stockholm. SIWI identifies a conference theme to place a specific focus on one aspect of the world's escalating water crisis. Initially, one theme was promoted for 4-5 years. Since 2008, a different theme has been selected for each year.
== Earlier World Water Week Themes ==
* '''1992-1997''': "Minimising Harmful Fluxes From Land to Water" * '''1998-2002''': "Water is the Key to Socio-economic Development and Quality of Life" * '''2003-2007''': "Drainage Basin Security: Prospects for Trade Offs and Benefit Sharing in a Globalised World" * '''2008''': "Progress and Prospects on Water: For A Clean and Healthy World." Special attention was given to [[sanitation]] issues as part of the [[International Year of Sanitation]] 2008. * '''2009''': "Responding to Global Changes: Accessing Water for the Common Good with Special Focus on Transboundary Waters" * '''2010''': "Responding to Global Changes: The Water Quality Challenge — Prevention, Wise Use and Abatement" * '''2011''': "Responding to Global Changes: Water in an Urbanising World" * '''2012''': "Water and Food Security" * '''2013''': "Water Cooperation — Building Partnerships" * '''2014''': "Energy and Water"<ref>[http://www.worldwaterweek.org/programme/#since-1991 Archives for World Water Week]</ref> * '''2015''': “Water for Development”<ref>[http://www.worldwaterweek.org World Water Week website, accessed 6/29/2015]</ref> *'''2016''': *'''2017:''' *'''2018:''' "Water, Ecosystems and Human Development"<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.worldwaterweek.org/programme/#since-1991|title=2018 World Water Week Programme|last=|first=|date=5 June 2018|website=worldwaterweek.org|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=5 June 2018}}</ref>
==See also== *[[World Water Day]]
==References== {{Refimprove|date=January 2017}} {{reflist}}
==External links== * [http://www.worldwaterweek.org/ World Water Week Website]
